instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor fine
threads.message:
Water damaged board, ran it in UC, reflowed PM and the 2 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> as I was only getting 5v after that board now starts up and I get image on external monitor, tested with 2 known good LCD screens and new LCD flex, no image either.

No shorts on LCD connector

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> Left and Right are both 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0v

<CHIP>U8510</CHIP> pin 1 0.9v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor fine
threads.message:
3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> must appear at least in the first few seconds.
Then LCD must release <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>.
If not, power cannot be maintained on LCD connector.
PCH needs the HPD signal to recognize the LCD properly.
The same PCH is the one which must start this sequence, releasing first <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> for few seconds.

"<CHIP>U8510</CHIP> pin 1 0.9v"
This could be your unique problem; follow the trace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor fine
threads.message: Thanks, indeed it was pin 1 not getting 3.3v the problem, the weird thing is that the connection between <RESISTOR>R8511</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8518</CAPACITOR> looked clean and there was no liquid damage near that area, but somehow those 2 were not connected via its traces.
